document.docAuthor: Campos, Breno Batista, Nunes, Benedito Mendes, Bitar, Murilo Victor Silva & Fernandes, Jose Antonio Marin
document.docTitle: Edessa brunneofasciata Campos & Nunes & Bitar & Fernandes 2020, sp. n.
document.masterDocTitle: Description of a new group of species of Edessa Fabricius, 1803 (Hemiptera: Pentatomidae: Edessinae) with translucent spot on hemelytra

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of a new group of species of Edessa Fabricius, 1803 (Hemiptera: Pentatomidae: Edessinae) with translucent spot on hemelytra

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. This name refers to the brown stripe on corium (Medieval Latin. Brunneus: brown. Latin. Fascia: band, stripe).

paragraph.materialsCitation: Holotype male. EL SALVADOR . La Libertad . Santa Tecla , Nº. 714.73. Date 10–23–56, Col. PAB ( USNM ).

subSubSection.paragraph:

Measurements . antennomeres length: 1st: 0.7–0.8; 2nd: 1.2–1.6; 3rd: 1.3–1.7; 4th: 2.8–2.9; 5th: 2.8–3.0; head length: 1.1–1.6; head width: 2.2–2.4; pronotal length: 2.0–2.6; pronotal width: 6.3–7.4; scutellum length: 4.6–5.3; scutellum width: 3.6–4.9; abdominal width: 5.6–7.0; total length: 11.1–13.1.
Description. Head. Apices of mandibular plates black.

Male ( Fig. 4 A–C). Dorsal rim of pygophore slightly projected, darker than dorsal surface, ending in a suture separating it from each posterolateral angle ( Fig. 4A ). Superior process of the genital cup black, elliptical, almost as long as parameres. Each paramere medially concave; anterior lobe subtriangular, almost reaching base of proctiger; posterior lobe tongue-like, curved laterally, touching superior process ( Fig. 4B ). Proctiger posterolaterally excavated, each excavation shallow ( Fig. 4B ), dorsally delimited by raised crest; posterior proctigeral face subtrian- gular, larger than in
E. bryoviridis
sp. n.
, mostly black. Ventral rim with a medial shallow excavation delimited by rounded, slightly tumid, well-developed expansions passing level of posterolateral angles in ventral view ( Fig. 4C ). Ventral surface densely punctured, rugose medially.

Comments. See discussion of
E. bryoviridis
sp. n.
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution ( Fig. 6 ). MEXICO : Chiapas ; GUATEMALA : Guatemala , Escuintla ; EL SALVADOR : San Salvador , La Libertad ; COSTA RICA : Guanacaste .
